title: How to Charge an Apple Watch Without a Charger

steps.title: No, you cannot charge an Apple Watch without a magnetic charger.
steps.content: No, you cannot charge an Apple Watch without a magnetic charger. [1] X Research source In order to charge your watch you must use the magnetic charger that came with it, or another charger that is made to work on Apple Watches. [2] X Research source Apple Watch 7 and newer have no ports on the device, so there is nowhere to plug a different type of charging cable into the device. [3] X Research source Apple Watch 6 and earlier may have a hidden six-pin port located behind the bottom strap . [4] X Research source In the past, accessories were sold that could charge the watch via this port, but there are no cables or accessories on the market today that can charge the watch this way. All Apple Watches come with the required cable to charge them.

steps.title: You can buy replacement cables from Apple.
steps.content: You can buy replacement cables from Apple. As you can only charge the Apple Watch via a magnetic cable, the easiest way to get a new cable is to buy it directly from Apple. [5] X Research source You can purchase the cable from Apple online, or visit a retailer in-person who is authorized to sell Apple products.

steps.title: Plug the magnetic charging cable into any power adapter.
steps.content: Plug the magnetic charging cable into any power adapter. You can use any power adapter to charge the watch as long as the plug matches the port. Below are some ideas for possible power adapters: Apple charging bricks Charging blocks from other manufacturers Laptop or desktop computer Power bank

steps.title: Use an alternative Apple charger.
steps.content: Use an alternative Apple charger. Apple sells the MagSafe Duo Charger, which can be used to charge your Apple Watch as well as your MagSafe-compatible iPhone, AirPods case, or other Qi-certified devices.

steps.title: Use a third-party product.
steps.content: Use a third-party product. While Apple doesn't recommend using third-party products in their ecosystem, plenty of manufacturers have made third-party chargers for the Apple Watch. This may be a cheaper alternative to buying Apple-branded products, but there is always a risk that these products may damage your device.
